entry.title: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
The open nature of SAP Datasphere's architecture is very much like Sergio Leone's epic spaghetti Western film, "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" for no reason other than how some designs can be described as such.

One of Datasphere‚Äôs biggest strength is the flexibility in how quickly a new solution can be built. It is delightfully fast. From the initial replication of SAP tables to a consumption-ready Analytical model, the development time is a fraction of prior efforts. Unfortunately, this same speed when unsupervised can lead to an excessive number of objects that will clutter and ironically slow down development.

Issues with Runaway Spaces

  • Production models using Development data
  • Transports of objects between spaces break
  • Navigation and development become a chore

If you're considering SAP Datasphere as a BW replacement or if you're already kicking the tires with a pilot project, this will help (and save you months of rework).

After implementing SAP Datasphere for a couple of clients, I've encountered limitations of the common, initial setup (The Bad) and worked through the growing pains of architecture the landscape to a scalable design that accommodates multiple teams and lines of business (The Good).

The First Design ‚Äì Our Initial Approach

  • 1-tenant
  • 1-space per environment

An initial design may look like this, which isn't all that bad (but there is a better approach that I will explain later).

It is simple concept to understand. The development objects are drafted in a Development space (DEV). The refined objects are imported and tested in a Quality Assurance space (QA). The approved objects are reviewed and imported into a Production space (PRD).

This approach isolates the objects based on their maturity along the development, testing, and approval process. It also helps the technical team as they explore SAP Datasphere concepts, such as graphical versus SQL views, relational vs. fact, dataflow vs replication flow, and so forth. It's a good start.

 

The First Issues

We started running into trouble, however, during promotion or "transports" of objects.

Because each space was a different database schema, we had to take care when exporting the CSN file that contained our object definition, which required manually editing the database prefix via a text editor before importing it into the next space.

We had edit access to the three spaces, so sometimes we find an object in the Quality Assurance or Production space may be referring an object from the Development space.

This issue was compounded as our team grew and required additional coordination.

  • How can we ensure business analysts do not change IT-developed objects?
  • How do we define security so that only the approved personnel can view sensitive information?
  • Is everyone following the same approach for development, testing (quality assurance), and production?

Our SAP Datasphere architecture had to adapt and service the growing IT team and the addition of new business groups. The number of mistakes increased as the teams grew. We had to find another way.

 

The Revision

The Second Design ‚Äì Our Revision

  • 2-tenants (PRD and DEV/QA)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space

Our second design of the Datasphere architecture separated the initial, inbound tables into its own space.

This allowed use to refine the role of the modelers, separating the ones who were developing the master data dimensions and relational datasets apart from those who had additional access to maintain system connections and monitor data flows and tasks chains. This was an IT-centric approach because we were on boarding more data engineers to help with the workload while defining roles and responsibilities.

With the second SAP Datasphere tenant, the transport process was smoother since we no longer had to manually edit CSN files. Also, the concern about mixing Production and Development objects were gone because the objects were in different tenants.

I imagine most teams stop here and this approach works well for IT-centric organizations where the data engineers are responsible for most of the data modeling. This approach also allows the larger group of data engineers to focus on building the data models while a smaller group maintain and coordinate the data loads as not overwhelm the environment.

 

The Final Architecture

The Third Design ‚Äì Our Current Architecture

  • 3-tenants (PRD, QA, and DEV)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 admin-space
  • n business-space

Our third design of the SAP Datasphere architecture grew out of the initial success of our reporting and data project.

The business teams were excited with their new dashboards and the speed in which our team were able to deliver new models. The demand from our business community exceeded our team's ability to deliver due to the volume of the requests. Around this time, there was a concern about data sensitivity especially around the company financial information.

The admin-space allowed use to define row-level security via Data Access Controls (DAC). Once defined, these objects can be shared to the modeling-space. Very few people on the team were granted access to maintain objects in the admin-space.

The modeling-space remains largely the same. The data engineers continued to build their initial propagation views and fact views, maintaining the relationships and semantic enrichment. What changed was the omission of analytical models.

When ready, the fact views were shared to the business-specific spaces. This allowed the business analysis to further refine the models for their specific needs, such as adding custom restrictive measures, calculations, or aggregations.

This 3-layered approach (inbound, modeling, and reporting) allowed the data engineers who are familiar with the source SAP table relationships to build a strong foundation in the modeling-space while allowing the business analysis to consume and tailor the output.

 

Next Time

If I were to build another SAP Datasphere tenant from the ground-up, I would keep the spaces to a minimum but allow the tenant to expand with the growing pains (of rearchitecting). In essence, it would be a slimmed version of the third design.

The Space Template

  • 2-tenant (minimum), 3-tenant (recommended)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 reporting-space

Now that SAP Datasphere (formerly Data Warehouse Cloud and recently packaged under SAP Business Data Cloud) has been released and used by customers for a several years now, I‚Äôm curious to hear how it‚Äôs been deployed. How are you organizing the Spaces (by domain, team, or lifecycle)? Who owns the metric definitions across Spaces? How do you package the Datasphere models so that the SAC teams can consume them easily?

entry.title: Tree-Table Support in CAP is Now Generally Available
entry.content:
Since July, the Tree-Table Support in the SAP Cloud Programming Model (CAP) is generally available. This exciting milestone represents the culmination of months of dedicated work. Our journey began in February with the initial release of Hierarchy Maintenance in the Tree Table for Java, followed in March by Recursive Hierarchies and Fiori Tree Table support for Node.js in beta. Since then, we‚Äôve consistently rolled out new features in beta, leading up to July 2025 when we officially announced that CAP's tree view support has exited beta and is now generally available.

Key Features

  • Hierarchical Entities Definition: Use standard OData/Fiori annotations to define hierarchical entities.
  • Hierarchical Queries: Hierarchical queries from the underlying SAPUI5 Tree Table components are generically served by CAP runtimes.
  • Read-Only Usage: Hierarchical entities can be used in read-only mode in List Views and Value Helps, including expanding/collapsing of an entire tree or separate nodes as well as sort, filter, and search functionalities on hierarchical data.

  • Modification Capabilities for draft enabled entities:
    • Node Operations: Create new nodes, add them as root or child nodes, modify and delete nodes, and change a parent of a child node (node movement).

    • Hierarchy Management: Deleting a node will cascade the deletion to its descendant nodes if they are in a composition relationship with the deleted node.
    • Object Page Support: The same set of modifications is supported on the Object Page, with the main difference, that all nodes on the List View have their own drafts, but all nodes on the Object Page belong to the same draft.
  • Database Support:
    • For Java we already support SAP HANA and H2, with PostgreSQL to follow.
    • For Node.js we support SAP HANA, SQLite, and PostgreSQL.

Current Limitations

We want to keep you informed about what‚Äôs not (yet) supported so you can plan accordingly:

  • Interception and modification of hierarchical queries in custom handlers
  • Arbitrary OData query options other than the ones served today for SAPUI5 Tree Table

Get Started

  • Demo: Check out our demo session recording from reCAP 2025: TreeTables Support in CAP.
  • Try it out: Explore the new features in our bookshop sample apps for CAP Java and CAP Node.js.

The general availability of Tree-Table Support in CAP opens up a wealth of opportunities to streamline hierarchical data management. We encourage you to dive in, explore the capabilities, and share your experiences with the community.

Happy coding!

entry.title: How to create a namespace in SAP BTP Credential store via API
entry.content:
I am trying to create a namespace via api but I am getting 403 error, is it possible to do? I was able to create passwords and access it but am unable to create a namespace. I have added the code I am using

async function createNamespace(vcapServices, namespaceName) {
    if (!vcapServices || !vcapServices['credstore']) {
        throw new Error('VCAP_SERVICES environment variable not found or credstore service not bound');
    }

    const binding = vcapServices['credstore'][0]['credentials'];
    
    const url = `${binding.url}/namespaces`;
    const auth = Buffer.from(`${binding.username}:${binding.password}`).toString('base64');
    
    // Prepare server public key for encryption
    const serverPublicKeyPem = `-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\n${binding.encryption.server_public_key}\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----`;
    const serverPublicKey = await jose.JWK.asKey(serverPublicKeyPem, 'pem');
    
    // Prepare payload for encryption
    const payload = JSON.stringify({
        name: namespaceName
    });
    
    try {
        // Get current timestamp for 'iat' header
        const issuedAt = Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000);
        
        // Encrypt the payload using JWE with required 'iat' header
        const encryptedPayload = await jose.JWE.createEncrypt({
            format: 'compact',
            contentAlg: 'A256GCM',
            fields: { 
                alg: 'RSA-OAEP-256',
                iat: issuedAt
            }
        }, serverPublicKey)
        .update(payload)
        .final();
        
        const headers = {
            'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}`,
            'Content-Type': 'application/jose'
        };

        const response = await fetch(url, {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: headers,
            body: encryptedPayload
        });

        if (!response.ok) {
            const errorText = await response.text();
            throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}, message: ${errorText}`);
        }

        console.log(`Namespace '${namespaceName}' created successfully`);
    } catch (error) {
        throw new Error(`Error creating namespace '${namespaceName}': ${error.message}`);
    }
}

entry.title: Public Sector highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release
entry.content:
As planned, the Public Sector Management (PSM) Global scope bundle is now available for over 20 countries, including France, Italy, Spain, Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Mexico, and Saudi Arabia.  With ever increasing demand, we continue the planned expansion to additional countries in 2602.  Check out the roadmap for details.  

Cloud ERP core enhancements

As always, there‚Äôs a range of new core Cloud ERP feature-based innovations for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with the 2508 release. If you are interested in other areas of innovations for SAP‚Äôs Cloud ERP, please check out the Release Video from Bert Schulze:

 

 


Screenshot + URL: Get the top highlights of the 2508 release in this video by Bert Schulze

New AI Features for Public Sector

The AI-assisted easy filter in SAP Fiori elements-based applications allows users to define filter queries using natural language, making it easier to find specific entries without manually applying filters. Users can toggle between Classic mode and SAP Business AI-mode, view favorite and last used queries, and easily reset filters to display all entries. ‚ÄãThis feature has now been enabled within the SAP Fiori app, Manage Budget Documents, allowing budget users to use budget document attributes and natural language to easily find what they are looking for.‚Äã AI-assisted filter criteria can be saved as a view and defined as a default view to help make it easier to find these same objects every time, including the ability to save a public or private view.‚Äã
‚Äã

‚ÄãTry typing ‚Äúnot posted‚Äù and automatically filter on all document statuses except posted.

‚Äã

 

Typing ‚Äòsender over 1k usd created in last fortnight‚Äô will automatically filter on large budget transfers in the last 2 weeks.

In the SAP Fiori Launchpad, you can use the AI-assisted enterprise search to access public sector management objects like fund and grant. Depending on your business role, you see a list of business objects in the‚Äã SAP Fiori Launchpad search dropdown. This feature allows you to use natural language for searching public sector management business data. You can enter your search queries in natural language in the SAP Fiori Launchpad search bar to find the information you need.‚Äã

Enable natural language search on business objects by selecting the checkbox ‚ÄôEnable AI Natural Language Search‚Äô from the user profile settings. ‚Äã On selecting the checkbox, you can view the list of business objects that are configured for natural language search.

Try searching ‚Äúshow me funds created recently‚Äù and get a list of newly created funds.

   

    
PSM Global

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release delivers a robust suite of Grants and Budget Management features tailored for public sector entities, including state and local governments, non-profits, cities, K-12 schools, and education & research institutions.

Building upon previous releases, the 2508 update introduces new capabilities designed to support public sector customers. Read on for an overview of the latest advancements.

For more details on the global PSM scope bundle, visit the SAP Process Navigator to explore the complete list of available scope items.

Screenshot: Process Navigator focused on S/4HANA Public Cloud and the PSM industry capabilities.


Workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management

Manage Workflows for Earmarked Funds has been enhanced with enabling the workflows for earmarked funds from contract and lease management.

When a lease-in contract is created, earmarked funds are generated automatically, subject to approval settings. You can specify whether all changes, only initial changes, or no changes require approval. The workflow is managed through the "Manage Workflow for Earmarked Funds" step, where properties, conditions, and steps are defined. The default procedure from the Workflow for Earmarked Funds Document is used, ensuring that subsequent processing aligns with the initial setup. (source ‚Äì Joule!)

‚ÄãOverview

  • Enablement of workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management
  • Ability to determine approval procedure

Benefits

  • Enable effective budget control by providing the ability for the budget manager to approve or disapprove the commitment from contract and lease management
  • Improve efficiency by streamlining approval process
  • Boost collaboration and compliance

‚Äã  

Screenshot: workflow for earmarked funds with Contract and Lease Management.

 

Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Public Sector Management (PSM) now offers the Budget Consumption Review Booklet application to perform a detailed review of the PSM budget line items, commitment/actual lines items, and budget and commitment actual line items and other relevant details.

 * available 2508.1 release, with incremental feature releases over the next few months

Overview:

  • Combines the queries for the Budget Line Item Analyzer, the Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer, and the Budget and Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer
  • Includes pages for each of the 3 reports, viewing each by revenue, expense, or combined
  • Includes all the filters and key figures available in the earlier line item analyzer reports

Benefits:

  • Ability to enter and save comments at the field, page, or report level
  • AI Business Insights and Navigate To features planned for future incremental releases

Screenshot: Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Availability control (AVC) and budget address validations during the import of financial plan data

It is possible to either import PSM budget (via excel upload or via interface from SAC) or create budget documents. During these activities budget addresses and AVC control addresses are never allowed to be negative. Through the ‚ÄúImport Financial Plan Data‚Äù app or SAC interface, this new feature checks to avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC and to avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)‚Äã

Overview

During the budget upload through the ‚ÄúImport Financial Plan Data‚Äù app, new checks to:

  • Avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC
  • Avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)
  • During budget upload and SAC imports the automatic validations are performed and will show possible overruns before the budget data is updated.

Benefits

  • Improve budget consistency (for example, avoiding unwanted negative budgets)
  • This functionality also avoids an accidental deletion of budget data in case the overwrite indicators are set incorrectly. It also avoids the possible deletion of budget documents with header information. ‚Äã

 

Screenshot: error message in upload log

 

Using statistical projects with public-sector management

You can automatically derive PSM account assignments from statistical WBS elements when the cost center does not have a fixed assignment. For example, if you set a fixed PSM account assignment on a statistical WBS element and do not set one on the cost center, the system uses the assignment from the statistical WBS element.  This feature allows for better management of budget for statistical projects.

Screenshot: PSM account assignments on a statistical project

 

Position budgeting with funds pre-commitments and budget availability check

  • Enable financing of positions with their corresponding funding sources, such as funds, grants, or functional areas, and monitoring and control of budget consumption
  • Create earmarked fund precommitments in SAP Cloud ERP to reserve the position budget
  • Finance vacant positions

Benefits

Enable accurate budget monitoring and control of personnel expenses by allowing the financing of positions in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Features

When a new employment gets created in SAP SuccessFactors, based on the employment costs, the necessary budget gets reserved in SAP Cloud ERP through an earmarked funds document of type commitment document. When an employee gets hired in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, based on the salary of the employee, the budget gets reserved in the SAP Cloud ERP system through an earmarked funds document, of type Commitment document. During every payroll run for the employee, the existing commitment document gets adjusted with the corresponding payroll actuals amount, and the corresponding actuals document is created and posted in the SAP Cloud ERP.

  • You can finance employees in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central by using Position Budgeting Control for Cloud. The financing uses information from the funds commitment amount in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Position Budgeting Control for Cloud allows you to ensure that employees are sufficiently budgeted for a specified financial period.

 

Picture: Position Budgeting Control ‚Äì Financing Details.

 

Key Summary

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition latest 2508 release brings key enhancements, including AI-driven user experiences, embedded AI features, and improved Grants and Budget Management capabilities.  This release continues to drive efficiency, scalability, and sustainability in ERP operations for public sector organizations. Please join us in the Cloud ERP revolution and explore how these innovations can unlock your organization‚Äôs full potential.

Trial System

Want to try out S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, for public sector?   Get a closer look at budget and grants management scenarios?   Access the public trial system.  Register for a free, two-week trial and take it for a spin.   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, public sector Trial

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand‚Äìanywhere, anytime.

üîéFind all our assets

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

ÂèÇËÄÉÊ†áÂáÜÊñáÊ°£Ëß£ÈáäÔºöSubcontracting is also possible in conjunction with sales order stocks and project stocks. The subcontracting orders are account-assigned to a sales order or a WBS element. Thus, the components are not transferred (using a transfer posting) to the "stock of material provided to vendor" but are directly withdrawn from the sales order stock or the project stock at the time of the goods receipt. The material manufactured is also posted to the sales order stock or to the project stock. The cost of subcontracting is then debited to the sales order or WBS element. Since the components are not transferred to the "stock of material provided to vendor", we recommend that you use a transfer posting to transfer the provided components to a new storage location (for example, 9999). This enables you to obtain an overview of those stocks that are physically located at the subcontractor. This information is particularly important when you carry out a physical inventory of the sales order stocks and project stocks.

entry.title: Variable Pay Worksheets - Objectives appearing only for the one of the two Bonus Plans
entry.content:
Dears, 

We encounter this problem: In employee‚Äôs profile, there are two records in the Compensation Information. After importing employees from Employee Central and running the Bonus Calculation, we launched the Variable Pay worksheet. In the View Details section, the calculated amounts are correct. However, Objectives are only appearing for one of the two Bonus Plans ‚Äî specifically, the Annual Bonus Plan linked to the most recent Compensation Information record.

Our configuration includes:

  • Bonus Calculation Equation:
    base x (business performance + team performance + individual performance)
  • Rating Configuration > Display Assignment As:
    Aggregated as one payout summary row 

     Many thanks in advance.

      any thoughts? 

     

    @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Issue in processing multiple PO in behavior class usi...
entry.content:
Hello @Renuga 

You are seeing this because EML functions within RAP's behaviour logic.:

  • When you modify another BO (here: I_PurchaseOrderTP_2) from a behaviour class, your EML must run IN LOCAL MODE so the changes are buffered in the same save sequence as your outer BO
  • If you fire several MODIFY ENTITIES calls without IN LOCAL MODE, only the last call is recorded in the interaction buffer; earlier ones do not make it to the final save.
  • Also ensure each generated child row has a unique %cid (per request)

Use this alternative (single shot, local mode, unique CIDs)

DATA lt_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE

  I_PurchaseOrderTP_2\purchaseorderitem\_PurOrdPricingElement.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO1'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO1_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '1'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO2'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO2_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '2'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 **IN LOCAL MODE**

  ENTITY PurchaseOrderItem

    CREATE BY \_PurOrdPricingElement

      SET FIELDS WITH lt_create

  MAPPED   DATA(mapped)

  FAILED   DATA(failed)

  REPORTED DATA(reported).

 

" Optional: check failures

IF line_exists( failed-purchaseorderitem[  ] ).

  " handle/log messages from 'reported'

ENDIF.

 

If you prefer separate calls

You can still issue the MODIFY ENTITIES command twice, but make sure to add IN LOCAL MODE to each call and use different %cids.

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

Extra checks

  • Ensure the PO items exist and aren‚Äôt locked by another LUW.
  • Avoid using COMMIT WORK within behaviour classes‚Äîthe framework commits after SAVE is triggered.
  • Inspect FAILED/REPORTED after the first call; if it‚Äôs not in local mode, you‚Äôll usually see no hard error, just the earlier changes being overwritten by the next interaction.

Below are some helpful SAP Documentation

  1. SAP Help ‚Äì Entity Manipulation Language (EML): explains IN LOCAL MODE and how it affects buffering and checks in the save sequence. SAP Help Portal-Entity Manipulation Language (EML)
  2. ABAP Keyword Doc ‚Äì MODIFY ENTITY/ENTITIES: full syntax and usage for RAP MODIFY with CREATE BY/associations. SAP Help Portal-MODIFY ENTITY, ENTITIES-ABAP Keyword Documentation

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: ‚Äåüá®üá≥‚Äå 2025 CSUA Annual Conference
entry.content:
The China SAP User Association (CSUA) invites SAP professionals, enterprise leaders, and technology experts to its 2025 Annual Membership Conference and 13th Anniversary Celebration!

This year‚Äôs theme, Suite-Driven Business, AI-Empowered Future, reflects the evolving intersection of enterprise digitalization and artificial intelligence.

The morning agenda features a series of focused sessions covering both business and technical topics. Key areas include:

  • SAP Business Suite and Business AI
  • Generative large model applications
  • Data asset management and analytical reporting, et al. 

The afternoon will spotlight the prestigious 2025 CSUA Golden Dragon Awards. Award-winning enterprises will present their Golden Dragon Annual Aotian projects, showcasing leadership in digital transformation.

Additionally, CSUA will officially release a series of group standards developed in collaboration with member enterprises.

This conference is targeted at members of CSUA and SAP user organizations (limited seats).

Check out the agenda and register here. 

If you want to learn about the localization topics in China provided by SAP experts, join the Greater China - Human Capital Management Localization WorkZone group.

entry.title: Manually Adding Employees to Compensation (Duplicates)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

Are you aware of a way to control employee membership when manually adding employees to a compensation worksheet? What we‚Äôre trying to achieve is a standard validation that checks whether an employee is already part of the cycle and prevents the Admin from adding them again manually.

Currently, the system is generating worksheets with all eligible employees as expected. However, the Admin is still able to manually add employees afterward, and the system is allowing duplicates to be added. It would be really helpful if the system could display a warning‚Äîsimilar to the one shown when an employee is not eligible for the cycle.

Note: The ‚ÄúDo not duplicate employees‚Äù setting is enabled, but as per SAP KBA 2084284, this does not apply to employees added manually by the Admin.

Do you have any insights or workarounds for this?

entry.title: SAP APO deleting an order in the planning board, makes other process orders disappear
entry.content:
Issue happens in scheduling board in 000 version: if the user deletes an order in the schedule of sequenced process/planned orders, and doesn"t save.

After deletion, the user drags/pushes the first remaining "sequence" of orders to the expected start date a bit further in future.

When doing this, the whole train of orders vanishes.

This problem does not occur in SIM. So it probably has to do with the connection to S4

After saving or refreshing, the orders re-appear

/SAPAPO/CDPS0 - Detailed Scheduling Planning Board - Variable View

entry.title: Disable VizFrame default popover on data selection
entry.content:
I recently faced an issue while working with a VizFrame chart in SAPUI5.
My requirement was to disable/remove the default popover that appears when clicking on a data point in the chart.

Viz:VizFrame uiConfig="{applicationSet:'fiori'}"  id="VizChart"  vizType="column" 

After adding this Property, the default popover was removed automatically.

so question is Why Popover is Removed ?
Because in Fiori mode, SAP expects you to use your own popover or SmartPopover instead of the Viz standard one. That‚Äôs why the standard tooltip/popover is gone when you add this.

entry.title: Re: Email de notifica√ß√£o de entrega
entry.content:
Hello @ayglonfernando 

Good day

I understand what you require: in addition to the read receipt, you also want an email delivery confirmation (DSN ‚Äì Delivery Status Notification) when a purchase order is sent via CL_BCS.

Here‚Äôs the gist and how to troubleshoot it:

1) A read receipt is not the same as delivery confirmation.

  • The read receipt relies on the recipient‚Äôs mail client, which they can ignore.
  • Delivery confirmation (DSN) relies on the SMTP infrastructure along the route. ABAP can request DSN, but only the mail servers can generate and return a ‚Äúdelivered OK‚Äù (many providers send failure DSNs but not success DSNs).

2) In ABAP (CL_BCS)

Make sure you explicitly request delivery status before send( üòû

DATA(lo_send) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).

lo_send->set_document( lo_doc ).

lo_send->add_recipient( lo_rec ).

 

" Request DSN / status mails (use constants available in your release)

lo_send->set_status_attributes(

  i_requested_status = 'ALL'    " SUCCESS/FAILURE/DELAY as policy allows

  i_status_mail      = 'ALWAYS' ).

 

lo_send->send( ).

 

Exact constants may vary by release; the key is: request DSN explicitly.

3) On the mail server side (usually the real blocker)

Ask your email/admin team to verify:

  • The SMTP relay employed by S/4 advertises the DSN extension, as indicated by EHLO showing DSN.
  • It is set up to send successful DSNs, not just NDRS or failures. Many relays, such as some Exchange/Office 365 configurations, don‚Äôt send successful DSNs by policy.
  • Your SAP sender/domain is permitted to receive those DSN reports (not filtered by anti-spam)..
  • On-prem/PCE only: in SCOT, the SMTP node has DSN/status options enabled, and the send/status jobs are scheduled.

In Public Cloud (SaaS), you don‚Äôt have SCOT access, so DSN behaviour is entirely up to your external mail provider.

4) Why does it work in ECC but not now

Most often, the SMTP path changes during the move (to a new relay/gateway that doesn‚Äôt issue successful DSNs). ABAP still requests DSN, but the server simply doesn‚Äôt send the ‚Äúdelivered‚Äù notification.

5) Practical paths forward

  • Confirm your code requests DSN (step 2) and your mail relay supports/permits successful DSNs (step 3).
  • If your provider won‚Äôt send successful DSNs, use operational alternatives:
    • rely on the outbound status/monitor (message transferred) and
    • treat bounces/NDRs as failures, or
    • Use your mail gateway‚Äôs delivery tracking report.

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI Assit content (Useful references)DSN (SMTP extension): RFC 3461 ‚Äì SMTP Service Extension for Delivery Status Notifications. IETF DatatrackerRFC Editor

Read receipts (MDN): RFC 8098 ‚Äì Message Disposition Notification (successor to RFC 3798). IETF Datatracker

 CL_BCS method: SET_STATUS_ATTRIBUTES documentation (requesting status/DSN). SAP Help Portal

Exchange/Office 365 DSNs: Microsoft docs (NDRs are the common DSN type). Microsoft Learn

Public Cloud output email (no SCOT; use Output Management/external mail): SAP S/4HANA Cloud Output Management overview. SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Discrepancy in Amount Calculation D
entry.content: One straight forward approach is to have one manual header condition in your pricing procedure which should be placed after the tax condition type.  This lets you correct the final invoice total without altering item-level tax logic. Also, check whether the "Group Condition" is ticked for that tax condition type which should also reduce rounding discrepancies across items.

entry.title: Plant Maintenance Integration with FICO,MM,PP, QM,HCM,EHS and other modules
entry.content:
Plant maintenance integrates with many of the modules and below are the some of the modules that plant maintenance integrates with: 

FICO(Finance and controlling) :- 

Below are the integration points of plant maintenance with FICO.
Company Code: - A plant will always be assigned to the company code. 
Cost center: - Cost Center is an organizational unit within a controlling area that is used to collect and record costs incurred from business activities.
Investment order: -  investment order needs cost budgeting for an order will be done.
Allocation Structure: -  In the allocation structure the cost elements will be taken from the CO in which these cost elements will gets reflected is any maintenance order have consumption of materials, Labour cost, 3rd party material procurement etc... which will flow the costs to the FI. 
Asset master creation: - When an equipment is being created then the asset will be created with a configuration.
Settlement Of an Order: - The settlement of an order is actually being done for an order because at the cost needs to be settled.
Settlement Profile: - The settlement profile will be assigned to the order type.
Activity Type: - In activity type the price or the cost for labour per hour will be determined by FICO consultant and we need to maintain the activity type in the work center.

PP(Production Planning) :- 
Work Center: - In work center the capacity will be determined by the production planning team. Here the capacity refers to the availability of people and resources for maintenance work.
Equipment Master Data: - In equipment master data there is a field work center in the Location in which we need to give the production planning work center and whereas in the organization. 
Spare Part Preparation: - For example the spare part cannot be procured externally then the spare part will be produced by the production order and the settlement rule of order will be done to the maintenance order.
Refurbishment of Material:- Refurbishment of material will be done if any material in production needs to be repaired as soon as possible then we will just refurbish the material and replace the material within the machine as it was there before the breakdown.

MM(Material Management):-
Components:- The components that are required for maintenance of machine will be taken from the inventory.
Service Entry Sheet:- To procure the service from external that is the maintenance has to be done for a machine and there is no team that is present in the plant(internal team) then we will just raise purchase requestion from the maintenance order and after it the material management people will procure the service through ML81N."
Split valuation:- Split valuation for a material has to be configured so that we can perform the refurbishment order.
Details of plant:- The details of plant related namely Purchase Organization, Vendor, Supplier, Outline agreement number etc..
Serial Number Profile:- A serial number profile must be configured for the material to enable the creation of equipment for that material.
Goods Issue:- Goods issue needs to be done for the order otherwise the technician cannot perform the maintenance activities that are present in the order.
Goods Receipt:- Goods receipt has to be done for the Internal Refurbishment Order and the settlement will be done for the material.
Material Reservation:- after creating the maintenance order the materials will be reserved in the inventory automatically.
Procurement:- Procuring of non-stock material, service entry sheet through purchase requestion.

Quality Management:- 
CatLog Profile:- Catlog profile will be configured by the quality management team and it will be assigned for the equipment , functional location.
Calibration Order:- In calibration order inspection will be done and thereby the equipment can be used or not will be determined by the quality management team.

SD(Sales And Distribution):- 
The place where the sales and distribution as well as plant maintenance will gets integrated is in customer service module.

EHS(Environment Health & Safety):-
The integration part of PM with EHS comes only at the product safety, Work permit - while performing any maintenance at the dangerous or hazardous material or equipment's.

FREM(Flexible Real Estate Management):- 
Flexible real estate management and plant maintenance both comes under Enterprise Asset Management in SAP S/4 Hana.
Real Estate Object: - Real estate object will be considered as functional location/equipment.
Work order:- Notification and work order management √† maintenance requests originating from RE-FX can be turned into PM notifications/ orders but this will be done with the help of CRM.
Service Provider Coordination: - PM order can trigger external services with the help of MM (material management) to work on RE-FX managed asset.

HCM(Human Capital Management):-
Person Responsible:- Here the person can be assigned to the work order , work center, Technical Object, Operations in work order too.

DMS(Document Management System):-
Documents can be uploaded for the technical objects, notifications , work orders etc... for information or to follow the rules to keep the equipment runs smoothly.

The above are some of the modules for which the plant maintenance will integrate with.

Hope its informative and feel free to comment for any improvements or suggestions.

Regards,
Neeraj.

entry.title: How to launch automatically a dynamic hyperlink of a report with its cuid in SAP BO
entry.content:
Hi , 

We have a dimension ( name ->Object )  in sap BO 4.2 which contains names of several reports and we would like to launch them automatically  in a new window visualizing the content of the report directly  without customizing every link manually using OpenDocument but  identifying every report using its cuid. 

We think that only we can do that base on the universe level but even doing that base on universe level we have to do it manually  (Hyperlink with OpenDocument ). Can't we ?

Please let me know your solution to do it automatically 

Thanks in advance

To define an object as a dynamic hyperlink  (UDT)

  1. Right-click on the object and select Object Properties.
    The Edit Object Properties dialog displays.
  2. Type the select statement and include the appropriate hyperlink.
  3. Save the new properties.
  4. Right-click on the object and select Object Format.
    The Object Format pane displays.
  5. Select the option Read As Hyperlink.
  6. Click OK to save the format settings.
  7. Use your reporting tool to create the report and test the link

entry.title: Re: Issue with Guest User Provisioning to SAP IAS
entry.content:
Hi Ari

There's no scpecific atribute for such "guests" users or I should say "the users that not exist in IAS".

Your specific issue seems to be with the Subject name Identifier or NameID atribute. I guess your BTP applicaitions are using email from the "identity store". this works only if you have your users created in IAS. If you don't want all your users in IAS you can work with Identity Federation Enabled and then you can pick to use a Entra attribute instead of all atributes from IAS. You can even keep both, using Entra as a fallback.

This scenario not having the Guests created in IAS might work for your scenario, but in general SAP is going to an approach were you'll need the users created anyway. This might not be needed now or maybe not mandatory for your scenario but seems that long term is SAP approach since more and more aplications requiere IAS user existance.

If you want to create your Guests in IAS I'd suggest to use a IPS provisioning job, you can filter your Guest Users from Entra based on some attribute and provision them to IAS using specific atributes based on IPS transformation. This uses standard SCIM protocol, so as long as you find the proper Graph API filter it should be straightforward.

Once you have your internal plus Guests users in IAS you can work with IAS atributes as you have in the sceenshot.

As I said this might not be mandatory at this point for your scenario and you might also be able to work with Identity Federation and pass Entra Attributes to the BTP application of needed.
